snippet: Oklahoma does not have all of the lethal drugs necessary to carry out an execution set for this week, the state attorney general said Monday.
abstract: Oklahoma State Attorney Gen Seth Branham says state does not have all lethal drugs necessary to carry out scheduled executions; prisons agency says quirk in law prevents state from switching to electrocution or firing squad.
lead_paragraph: Oklahoma does not have all of the lethal drugs necessary to carry out an execution set for this week, the state attorney general said Monday.
